reviews.sentence: Do not stay here. Wednesday through Saturday nights here. On Saturday at 330pm our room was not clean. Asked housekeeper in hallway if she would please clean our room. We returned to our room at 10 pm after an evening out. Our room had not been cleaned. I called the front desk and Sandra Johnson Director of Sales Marketing told me everyone had left for the day and there was no one there to clean our room etc. I emphasized the late 10 pm hour and asked when someone could bring clean towels and clean our room. She did not know. I hung up the phone. I gathered our dirty towels and took them to the front desk. Granted I was not exactly pleasant at this point. A housekeeping night manager brought clean linens and towels out and we made our way back to our room. She offered to vacuum but we told her not to since the bathroom and bed were taken care of. Ms Johnsons response to my phone call was not appropriate especially since I had already asked someone to help me earlier in the day. The breakfast is not worth the 12 they charge. It is an expensive continental breakfast. The bathrooms are in need of an update and the carpeting throughout is old and worn. The wine offerings in the bar are of cheap wines and the atmosphere. Well let us just say I would not waste my time or money there. The lines at check in are very long approximately 10 to 12 people long so the wait time is trying. The so called business room is a joke. One of the computers had no keyboard. Really. Our bathroom was tight with only one sink and the cabinetry was in bad shape. The hotel location however is convenient.

Out in the middle of nowhere. The hotel has been refurbished. it is located in a residential neighborhood and nothing really around. The front desk personnel were not very helpful when requesting a different room. Our room was one what clean but there was dust and dirt under the bed. The room has a refrigerator. There is a mall nearby but you can not walk to it. I would not recommend this location unles it was a last resort.

Hotel stay. We are in Atlanta for medical tests. This hotel is in a great and quiet area. Easy checkin and friendly staff. The hotel was booked full. Unfortunately our room had heating problems and the toilet was not flushing properly. My husband went to the front desk and told them what was going on. They could not move us that night but immediately moved us the next morning after a room had been cleaned. They were most apologetic and upgraded us to a better room. Although this is an older hotel it was very clean and was perfect for our needs.

Average Holiday Inn. Air Conditioning problems during my 3 day stay. Very warm in my room during most of 2 daytimes and 1 overnight made for awful sleep. Breakfast not great buffet is 1495 much better at the Holiday Inn Expresss.

Standard. Checked in abot 120 noon. My king size bed room was not ready yet so took a two twin bed room. The hotel is being updated. The room was nice wi fi ok bed comfy and clean. Not much aroud the area but only here for one night.

In the past I have had a decent experience but I was in one of the recently renovated rooms. This go around I was not and have a poor excuse for a fridge. My keys were not programmed right for two days and on my last night stay I got no housekeeping. Yes those are minor things but after you have had a long day of work you are just looking forward to coming back to your room and just relaxing. I will say the bartender was great as well as my martini although a bit overpriced. I do not know why the downgrade in the room or being out on a floor with young spring breakers.

The first stay was bomb second stay sucked. That they had renovated rooms that was the bomb. That the whole second floor was not renovated and they put us on the second floor and we slept in a old room and did not know until we walked around and had to request a renovated room smh.

Disappointed. After a very pleasant stay in the HIE at Opelika we were expecting at least a comparable experience. We were very disappointed. The cooling system was out of order when we arrived to our room maintenance came got it running but it would not cool below 72 degrees. We again asked for someone to check on it they worked on it while we were out so we returned to our room at a chilly 65 degrees. Even after turning the system off the unit continued to run at 65 degrees until we again called for maintenance in the morning who had to disconnect the system. The office style chair at the desk was broken on one side so it sat crookedly. The lamp on the desk did not work and finally even though the web site listed a free breakfast buffet we were informed we would have had to request a voucher when booking to get one. The buffet was 1495 per person and given the quality of the food that was extremely too much.

Broken rods and no fridge. Broken curtain rods no light bulbs key cards that do not work not given requested room because you are with ball team no refrigerator even though everyone else had one and there is an empty place for one. Was told not every room gets one. How cheap. Just great when you are playing ball for a week. do not come here. Cheap cheap cheap.
I got an non renovated room because I needed to use the stairs. The room was simple and old. I believe after the renovation it will be better.

Nice reboot. This is not the greatest location for beautiful views and the hotel itself was a former Holiday Inn. it is in the process of complete renovation and bringing up to Hilton DoubleTree standard and inside it is great. Outside still needs some work but do not be put off by that. The location for convenience is very good. The staff was wonderful and I hope they can get this hotel going because it is worth your money. Couple things1. The showers are great Hilton standard but the door arrangement means you have to step inside the shower to turn it on thus you get wet and cold2. The A C units work great but at least the one in my room was massively loud. Maybe these were not all replaced in the modernization.

It looks nice. on the surface. We stayed for one night. We checked into a room with two double beds. The room does not have a light on the ceiling so the lamps on the bed built into the headboard and the floor lamp are all ya got for lighting. Well the light in the middle of one bed and the two reading lights on it did not work. We even went under the bed to make sure it was plugged in. It was still did not work. So we went back to the front desk and requested a new room. All of these rooms are redone with modern sleek decor. They LOOK great. but the function stinks. Again another room with no ceiling light. so even with ALL the lamps on in the room it is still dim. That evening went to take a shower. no hot water. it is 10 pm so not like it is prime time for showering. Let the shower run for 15 minutes to see if the hot water would kick in. It never did. so I had to take a COLD shower. That is crap. Went to brush my teeth. the sink got hot water. but it did not drain. I made sure it the drain was open. but every time we turned on the water. the sink filled with water. Gross. Whatever it was one night. so I guess I will deal with it. Went to bed. You know. you have a schedule in your mind for the next day so you set your alarm accordingly. 813 am. the freaking maid knocks on the door. Are you kidding me. There had to be other rooms where guests had already checked out that she could have worked on. Instead she is going to come knocking at my door and wake me up. Just a very UNREASONABLE timeframe to be knocking at a guest door. I will not stay here again. Also they have a sign in the room that they want you to be happy and will take care of any issues. I made a point of stopping by the front desk when we left to tell them about the issues. they listened and apologized. But that is all they did. So good luck to the next guest who stays in Room 203 with no hot water in the shower and the sink filled with drain water.

Not good at all. rooms had that rush to reopen look to them. there were cracks in the wall and holes round the wall outlets where they were measure wrong. I am about 63 and the shower bar and i met regularly. If you are below 60 you are fine. there is only one entrance into the shower and that is it. Location was good but a lot of questionable people around midnight. I heard people cussing and screaming outside. Security needs to be sure these people have a reservation or card key for entrance or something. The air conditioner was very loud and came on seem like every ten minutes. So i will not be back anytime soon.

The hotel was not what I expected. The room was very clean however the room definitely could have been a lot brighter and the bed mattress was ok. The two gentleman at the front desk were very accommodating and pleasant to work with. The staff at this hotel was what made my stay worthy.

Super friendly staff great restaurant. The staff was super friendly. I forgot a toothbrush and needed advice about Atlanta traffic they helped out big time on both questions. The wi fi in the room was great as was the restaurant near the lobby. The bartender was helpful and my food was brought out very quickly. I also had to leave early the staff took care of my bill and refunded my extra night at no compliant. Great place will stay there again no question. The only minor complaint was they let the room service garbage build up near the elevators on the second floor. that was sort of gross.
Gorgeous and clean hotel room. Friendly staff. They give you free cookies that are so delicious too.
Great room and wonderful event service.
good value for hotel. room was quite clean and comfortablenothing.
Rooms were clean and well appointed. The only glitch we had was we booked the shuttle and when time came to leave it was not available.
Room was beautiful and the service top notch. Fresh cookies are amazing and they even let me rest with a late check out. Definitely will come back.
Great stay. Staff was very polite and professional. Room was very clean and neat. Walls slightly thin but nothing that would make me not return. Always love the warm cookies ❤ ️ ❤ ️.
The stay was great. I really enjoyed being there. The rooms were very clean and the staff were very friendly. I would definitely stay there again. Oh the cookies were very delicious.
Love the location and nice rooms.
